key_risks: Regulatory and compliance risks, including potential delisting from NYSE due to non-compliance with Rule 802.01C

Valuation challenges for private company shares, leading to investor skepticism
Intensifying competition from platforms like CartaX and EquityZen

controversies: NYSE compliance notice for non-compliance with Rule 802.01C
High total debt to equity ratio of 4.10, indicating financial leverage risks
social_issues: Revenue per employee of $202,380, indicating operational efficiency but potential pressure on workforce
governance_issues: Regulatory compliance challenges, including SEC regulations and NYSE listing requirements

sources.title: forge-20241231 - SEC.gov
sources.snippet: On December 31, 2024, Forge Global Holdings, Inc. (the "Company") received written notice from the New York Stock Exchange (the "NYSE") that the Company is not in compliance with Rule 802.01C of the NYSE's Listed Company Manual ("Rule 802.01C") relating to the minimum average closing price of the Company's common stock required over a consecutive 30 trading-day period.
